Have you customized the crawl configuration at all -- especially with 
regard to the PreconditionEnforcer, FetchDNS, or Scope components?

What happens if you try using a bundled profile, with only the minimal 
changes necessary to run -- a valid 'user-agent' and 'from' -- on a 
representative seed?

On what OS are you running Heritrix?

FYI, most of the core team uses Eclipse; Heritrix 1.x should build and 
run in Eclipse without requiring Maven at all.

- Gordon @ IA

nfoscarini wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I'm new to Heritrix, and keep having this same problem. I've tried the
> 1.12 and 1.13 versions, but get the same results.
> 
> All the domains I enter into the seed list won't resolve. The crawler
> reports the below exception.
> 
> All these domains to resolve if I do it manually. I've tried clearing
> my DNS cache, and I can ping them without a problem.
> 
> I want to debug the application, but I don't know if NetBeans supports
> the maven build project that's being used.
> 
> Has anyone got Heritrix running under NetBeans?
> 
> Here's the exception ->
> 
> java.io.IOException: Failed to get host www.cnn.com address from
> ServerCache
> 	at
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.HeritrixProtocolSocketFactory.getHostAddress(HeritrixProtocolSocketFactory.java:164)
> 	at
> org.archive.crawler.fetcher.HeritrixProtocolSocketFactory.createSocket(HeritrixProtocolSocketFactory.java:124)
> 	at
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:707)
> 	at
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:386)
> 	at
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:170)
> 	at
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:396)
> 	at
> org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:346)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP.innerProcess(FetchHTTP.java:500)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.Processor.process(Processor.java:112)
> 	at
> org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:302)
> 	at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:151)
